author: GamingBolt
description:
Skate Story is worth checking out if you want a skateboarding experience with an excellent trick system and responsive controls, but also incredibly out there with its narrative and atmosphere. 

You wouldn't think a trash bag could serve as a complex labyrinth of perpetual blazes or that the path to Bagelworld could be so treacherous, but if you leap, these and many other wondrous sights await.
title: Skate Story Review - The Final Verdict

author: GamingBolt
description:
Warhammer 40k: Space Marine 2 was a great addition to 2024's lineup of games. While it did have its issues, Titus's latest adventure was a reward for the patience fans had shown over the years, and a power trip for players who learned to use the game's mechanics. 

But Saber hasn't rested on its laurels, and Space Marine 2 has seen a lot of great additions over the past year. But have they been enough? Join us and find it if this shooter deserveS your attention a year later.
title: Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 Is An Absolute Beast A Year Later

author: GamingBolt
description:
We all have that moment watching a game trailer that makes us gasp in awe. Some of the most memorable of these moments are with franchises we’re already familiar with. Seeing a sequel that you had lost all hope in seeing finally getting a trailer is electrifying, and it’s that feeling that inspired our list. 

These are the games that stir up nostalgia, or simply the promise of unrealized potential. Whether it’s Sony ignoring the cries for Bloodborne 2, EA refusing to budge on Titanfall 3, or Dino Crisis sitting dormant while fans beg for a revival, each of these titles represents a “what if” that could instantly dominate the gaming conversation.
title: If These 10 Games Dropped A Surprise Trailer, Which One Would You Lose It Over?
